RT @girlritz @oddboz @liberalgoddess @politicalnative @onefussyone I hope that means Doug Jones will be re-elected. So rare to have a good person as a politician, and Doug is a good man.
Like Doug says, "we can and will beat this if we all do our part. We will make it through this together." It's up to each of us: let's do our part, let's stay home and let's beat this together.
No vote in Washington is going to stop this virus -- only we can do that by listening to experts and that means staying home.
This bill is a good start to getting Alabamians the help they need right now, and Doug knows the Senate will likely need to do more -- but we all also have to do our part in this crisis.

The Senate passed a bill that also helps the American people directly:

- Expands unemployment benefits 
- Provides direct cash payments 
- Includes loans for our small businesses 
- Helps protect renters and homeowners to avoid evictions

This rescue bill gets aid to the hospitals and states that need it right now. Including:

-$130 billion in aid to hospitals (nearly double what Mitch McConnell was proposing) to get the supplies they need
- Providing $150 billion to help our states bear the cost of the pandemic

Doug worked hard to build a bipartisan consensus and create a better bill than Mitch McConnell's draft, which left too many people out in the cold. This rescue bill will start helping our families and the economy.
The Senate just passed the largest rescue bill in American history. It's going to help many people who are struggling right now in Alabama because of the #COVID19 pandemic.
